page.title: 16HAYFIELD,A CHANGING VILLAGE.
page.content: Where the village hall is,used to be Hayfield cinema, and where the library is on Kinder Road used to be the Highbourne Methodist Sunday school which my mum went to. The old library stood along where The Skillet car park is and at the side was a school which children attended until they were four.After that they went to the top school where we go today. The Hayfield to New Mills railway line is now a nature trail and the two signal boxes in between Hayfield and The Vine are now houses in which families live. The house next to Ken Rangely's paper shop used to be a barbers shop. The Hayfield by-pass has taken the heavy traffic from out of the village.The bus terminal which was in the Royal car park, is now at the entrance of the Sett Valley Trail.
